Description: Fragment of undyed, warp-faced plain weave linen, looped pile on the inner side, with a part of an applied tapestry clavus or shoulder stripe (c.5x16 cm) in linen and red wool; from the lower end of a short clavus ie: waist area of a tunic; the tapestry is in red wool and undyed linen, a band with a rounded end and narrow extension with finial missing, design of a running lion and a stylised spotted plant, double frame, the outer frame with a wave border; plain weave-warp undyed linen (S/c.31), weft-undyed linen (S/c.18); pile weft-undyed linen (S); tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/c.9/paired), weft-undyed linen and wool (S/c.80), edges turned under; there is some weft float brocading on the tapestry, pairs of red picks interspersed among linen weft, the tapestry is sewn/hemmed to the main textile with linen (S spun Z ply); a line of pile with every c.16-20th pick in the main weft, a loop after every c.4 warp ends; edges all ragged
Curator's comments: Unreg.19a;Unreg.19b; found in 1988? in the Keeper's Room
